intro: Eutrema yungshunense, commonly known as Yungshun's sea blush, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Yungshun, China. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in saline and coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, maritime conditions. Its leaves are typically succulent, helping it retain moisture in arid climates. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
